label: 大名
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: Major feudal lords with holdings of over 10,000 koku of rice. Daimyo were divided by the Tokugawa bakufu into various groups based on types of vassalage. The most important division was between shinpan (collateral houses), fudai（hereditary vassalage lords), and tozama［外様］ (outside lords")［徳川幕府、親藩、譜代、外様］"
